**Pelias**, @, is the [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian") [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader"). He is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivorous "Omnivorous") [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)") that can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

Pelias has a single weapon attack. Like the [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian") [chieftains](/wiki/Chieftain "Chieftain") and other Barbarians, he has [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 20cbadcf](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/20cbadcf85544cf9d0c3f4e4200b2800bab49c8e), killing quest leaders no longer makes the game [unwinnable](/wiki/Unwinnable "Unwinnable"), and Pelias and other quest leaders are given stat buffs and additional equipment to compensate. Pelias's [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") is increased to 15, his [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") becomes 90, and he has two 4d10 weapon attacks.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Origin](#Origin)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [4.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [4.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Pelias resides within the structure that sits on the west side of the [Barbarian quest](/wiki/Barbarian_quest "Barbarian quest")'s home level, occupying the [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") in the left half.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As part of [commit 20cbadcf](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/20cbadcf85544cf9d0c3f4e4200b2800bab49c8e), Pelias [always generates with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") +5 [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail") and a +5 [runesword](/wiki/Runesword "Runesword").

## History

Pelias is introduced with most other quest leaders in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[The Scarlet Citadel](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Scarlet_Citadel "wikipedia:The Scarlet Citadel")***

Pelias shares his name with a character from *The Scarlet Citadel*, a [*Conan* short story](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conan_the_Barbarian "wikipedia:Conan the Barbarian") written by *[Robert E. Howard](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_E._Howard "wikipedia:Robert E. Howard")* - the encyclopedia entry originates from its reprinting in 1967 collection *[Conan the Usurper](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conan_the_Usurper "wikipedia:Conan the Usurper")*. This Pelias is one of the rare sorcerers to ally with Conan: after Conan, king of Aquilonia, is betrayed and imprisoned within a Korshemish dungeon by the machinations of the Kothian wizard, he meets Pelias, a former rival wizard of Tsotha-lanti. Pelias frees Conan and helps him escape the dungeon, allowing Conan to regain his position as king of Aquilonia while Pelias later avenges himself against Tsotha-lanti.

## Variants

Some variants make Pelias and other quest leaders stronger to accommodate changes to the Quest and its entry mechanics, and these changes may be incorporated into upcoming versions of *NetHack* or else be borrowed from them.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), Pelias has his [difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") increased to 24. Pelias's [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") is increased to 15, his [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") is 90, and he has two 4d10 weapon attacks. He also gains [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), Pelias has his difficulty increased to 23 and is given an additional 0d6 [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") attack. All 10 points of his effective 0 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") are in the protection category.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), Pelias's stats and difficulty are improved as in SporkHack minus the flight and resistances.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), Pelias's stats are improved as in SporkHack minus the difficulty increase, flight and resistances.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), Pelias's stats and resistances are improved as in SporkHack minus the flight and difficulty increase.

Pelias [always generates with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") +5 [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail") and a +5 [runesword](/wiki/Runesword "Runesword"). If [The Ring of P'hul](/wiki/The_Ring_of_P%27hul "The Ring of P'hul") is successfully [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for by a non-Barbarian, there is a x⁄x+1 chance (where *x* is the amount of previous [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") wishes) of a hostile Pelias generating adjacent to the character with the artifact in his possession.

All of the above information also applies to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

## Encyclopedia entry

Conan cried out sharply and recoiled, thrusting his companion  
back. Before them rose the great shimmering white form of Satha,  
an ageless hate in its eyes. Conan tensed himself for one mad  
berserker onslaught -- to thrust the glowing faggot into that  
fiendish countenance and throw his life into the ripping sword-  
stroke. But the snake was not looking at him. It was glaring  
over his shoulder at the man called Pelias, who stood with his  
arms folded, smiling. And in the great, cold, yellow eyes  
slowly the hate died out in a glitter of pure fear -- the only  
time Conan ever saw such an expression in a reptile's eyes.  
With a swirling rush like the sweep of a strong wind, the great  
snake was gone.  
"What did he see to frighten him?" asked Conan, eyeing his  
companion uneasily.  
"The scaled people see what escapes the mortal eye," answered  
Pelias cryptically. "You see my fleshy guise, he saw my naked  
soul."

\[ Conan the Usurper, by Robert E. Howard and L. Sprague de Camp ]
